summary: The 'Expanding Access to Fertility Care for Servicemembers and Dependents Act' (H.R. 3025) aims to amend Title 10 of the United States Code to provide coverage for assisted reproductive services under the TRICARE program. It mandates coverage for eligible military members and their dependents, regardless of service-connected disabilities, ability to conceive, or sexual orientation/marital status. The bill defines "assisted reproductive services" broadly, including insemination, in-vitro fertilization, and cryopreservation.
